alert.note: Alert for Wayne (Michigan) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 23 at 3:09PM EDT by NWS Detroit
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of central Wayne County through 345 PM EDT... At 309 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Trenton, or near Flat Rock, moving north at 15 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. This strong thunderstorm will be near... Wyandotte around 330 PM EDT. Taylor and Romulus around 335 PM EDT. Dearborn and Greenfield Village around 345 PM EDT. Other locations impacted by this storm include Inkster, Brownstown Township, Melvindale, Gibraltar, Riverview, Ecorse, Allen Park, River Rouge, Woodhaven and Lincoln Park. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
